title.narrative: Uncovering power structures - the impact of global power structures on women's lives in the developing world

description.narrative: Global power structures produce inequality between individuals. Capitalist market economy creates economic inequality and divides mankind into poor and rich. Then again different gender roles and expectations attached to them create inequality between gend ers. The project seeks to raise awareness of the structures that create and uphold inequality and the consequences this has on the lives of women and girls in the developing world.The aim of the project is to increase young people?s knowledge about global power structures and women?s and girls? situation in developing countries. In addition to deepening their knowledge of the thematic areas the project will also appeal to young people?s emotions through experiment-focused and interactive methods and inspire and provide them tools for active citizenship. The primary target group of the project is approximately 1200 upper secondary education students and 45 teachers in the Uusimaa region. The project is in accordance with international as well as Finland?s own development objectives as it strengthens gender equality and reduces global inequality.The objectives will be reached through series of seven workshops with each student group 45 school visits 15 presentations and school day openings as well as social med ia outreach initiatives. 45 to 60 students will deepen their knowledge on the thematic area in the workshop series. In the workshops the students will focus on learning about critical information retrieval and media literacy debating and argumentation skil ls and the means to use social media as a tool for public discussion and advocacy work. In the workshops the students will carry out social media outreach initiatives that will raise awareness of the project?s thematic areas to social media followers. The students will also hold 15 school day openings or presentations on the thematic areas in their schools. Students' awareness and knowledge of the thematic areas will also be increased through 45 school visits. The teachers are encouraged to cover the themat ic areas in their teaching by creating them specific exercises for this purpose.The two-year project was granted 94 085 euro by MoFA.
